scenario:
BlackRock's iShares subsidiary offers over 1,400 ETFs, including the iShares U.S. Tech Independence Focused ETF (IETC) which invests in companies that help the US achieve technological independence. The ETF holds 117 stocks, with top holdings including Broadcom, Amazon, Nvidia, and Microsoft, which are leaders in AI hardware and software. 

Broadcom's AI revenue increased 220% in 2024, with its stock more than doubling. Nvidia's data center GPUs remain the most popular for AI development, with its new Blackwell GPUs offering up to 30 times more performance than its previous Hopper GPUs. Amazon and Microsoft are integrating AI into their legacy businesses and offer ready-made large language models for developers.

The iShares ETF has delivered a 20.6% compound annual return since its establishment in 2018, outperforming the S&P 500 index. Adding the ETF to a diversified portfolio can have remarkable benefits, with a $50,000 investment in the S&P 500 and 30% in the iShares ETF worth $141,166 today, compared to $123,585 in the S&P 500 alone.

Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang predicts data center operators will spend $1 trillion over the next four years on AI infrastructure upgrades, while PwC estimates AI will add $15.7 trillion to the global economy by 2030. The AI boom has legs, and investors should consider adding the iShares ETF to their portfolio.
